TEI.2.document_title: Governor H. Johnson to Stephen F. Austin, 05-09-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: H. Johnson, governor of Louisiana, to Bastrop, May 9, 1825. Concerning recovery of 10 African negroes stolen from Alabama while under adjudication of Federal district court.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: On the subject of this letter see Gaines to Austin, August 13, 1825.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*H. Johnson, governor of Louisiana, to Bastrop, May 9, 1825. Concerning recovery of 10 African negroes stolen from Alabama while under adjudication of Federal district court.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="05-09-1825">9th May, 1825.*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir:*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Green D. Caller [Collier]*/person_mentioned*, who will present this letter, goes to the *location_mentioned*Province of Texas */location_mentioned*in pursuit of ten *person_mentioned*African negroes*/person_mentioned* which were stollen and carried off from the State of *location_mentioned*Alabama */location_mentioned*in the year *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1821">1821*/date_mentioned*, and which are said to be in the said *location_mentioned*Province*/location_mentioned*. The said *person_mentioned*slaws*/person_mentioned* were captured by *person_mentioned*Lt. Y. Mckeever*/person_mentioned* at *location_mentioned*Pensacola */location_mentioned*in the year *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1821">1818*/date_mentioned*, and were at the time of the theft under adjudication in the District Court of the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned* for the*location_mentioned* District of Alabama*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*It is said they were stollen by *person_mentioned*Robert Caller*/person_mentioned* out of the possession of his *person_mentioned*aunt*/person_mentioned*, who is one of the principals to the bond of $100,000 given for the forthcoming of the *person_mentioned*slaves */person_mentioned*at Court. The bearer of this letter, who is recommended to me as a man of respectability, is the *person_mentioned*son */person_mentioned*of the lady who had the *person_mentioned*slaves */person_mentioned*in possession, and feeling a deep interest in restoring them, has volunteered his services for the purpose.*/p*
*p*At the instance of a *person_mentioned*gentleman */person_mentioned*of this *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned*of high respectability, who is acquainted with the circumstances of the case, I take the liberty to address you upon the subject, and to solicit your friendly aid and authority in securing the *person_mentioned*slaves */person_mentioned*so that they may be restored to their rightful *person_mentioned*owners*/person_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Robert Caller*/person_mentioned* is represented as a desperate character, and may attempt, if not prevented by confinement, to rescue the *person_mentioned*slaves */person_mentioned*even at the risk of his life. It might perhaps be advisable, if satisfactory proof should be exhibited of his guilt, to send him back for trial to the place where the crime was committed.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*H. Johnson, Gov. of the State of *location_mentioned*Louisiana*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*His Excellency, *person_mentioned*Baron Bastrop, Governor of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
